definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: Exercising when it's cold and raining can make you more vulnerable to the cold.
sentences.chinese: 在冷雨天鍛鍊會使你更容易受寒。

sentences.english: The genesis is controlled by the ore-bearing sedimentary formation.
sentences.chinese: 礦牀的形成受寒武系沉積含礦建造控制。

sentences.english: When my father was a child he suffered hunger and cold and was often cursed and beaten.
sentences.chinese: 我爸爸小時候忍飢受寒，還經常捱打捱罵。

sentences.english: Fever or chills may be the only signs of infection.
sentences.chinese: 感染的症狀可能僅爲發熱或受寒。

definition: to catch cold/(common) cold/CL:場|场[chang2],次[ci4]/(coll.) to be interested in (often used in the negative)/(Tw) to detest/can't stand
to warm oneself/to expel the cold (TCM)

pinyin: shang4 hu1 xi1 dao4 gan3 ran3

definition: (in Chinese medicine) stasis (of blood or other fluids)
spleen and stomach (digestive organs in TCM)/preferences/one's taste (e.g. in literature)

pinyin: feng1 shi1 xing4 guan1 jie2 yan2
